intro: Dendropanax geniculatus, commonly known as the zigzag sedge, is a herbaceous plant native to eastern Australia. It is characterized by its erect, slender stems and narrow, grass-like leaves that are often arranged in a zigzag pattern, giving it its common name. The plant produces small, inconspicuous greenish flowers followed by dark blue berries that are edible for some bird species. It thrives in wetland environments and is often found in swampy areas along the eastern coast of Australia. Due to its unique morphology and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and ecologists studying wetland ecosystems.
